To delete a specific line in all the files, you can use a loop to iterate through all the files and lines in each file, and then use the `replaceFirst()` method to replace the line containing "char-15" with an empty string. Here's an example code snippet that demonstrates how to do this:
```java
import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        List<File> files = new ArrayList<>();
        files.add(new File("path/to/file1.txt"));
        files.add(new File("path/to/file2.txt"));
        // add more files here

        for (File file : files) {
            String contents = new Scanner(file).useDelimiter("\\A").next();
            Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile("char-15");
            Matcher matcher = pattern.matcher(contents);
            while (matcher.find()) {
                contents = contents.replaceFirst(matcher.group(), "");
            }
            new Scanner(file).useDelimiter("\n").forEachRemaining(contents::println);
        }
    }
}
```
This code first reads the contents of all the files into a list of strings, then uses a `Pattern` and `Matcher` to find the lines containing "char-15", and finally replaces those lines with an empty string. Finally, it prints the modified contents of each file to the console.
